lines.text: KING HENRY enters with his power. Alarum to the battle. Then enter DOUGLAS and SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.speaker: sir walter blunt
lines.text: What is thy name, that in the battle thus Thou crossest me what honour dost thou seek Upon my head

lines.speaker: earl of douglas
lines.text: Know then, my name is Douglas And I do haunt thee in the battle thus Because some tell me that thou art a king.

lines.speaker: sir walter blunt
lines.text: They tell thee true.

lines.speaker: earl of douglas
lines.text: The Lord of Stafford dear today hath bought Thy likeness, for instead of thee, King Harry, This sword hath ended him: so shall it thee, Unless thou yield thee as my prisoner.

lines.speaker: sir walter blunt
lines.text: I was not born a yielder, thou proud Scot And thou shalt find a king that will revenge Lord Staffords death.
They fight. DOUGLAS kills SIR WALTER BLUNT. Enter HOTSPUR

lines.speaker: hotspur
lines.text: O Douglas, hadst thou fought at Holmedon thus, never had triumphd upon a Scot.

lines.speaker: earl of douglas
lines.text: Alls done, alls won here breathless lies the king.

lines.speaker: hotspur
lines.text: Where

lines.speaker: earl of douglas
lines.text: Here.

lines.speaker: hotspur
lines.text: This, Douglas no: I know this face full well: A gallant knight he was, his name was Blunt Semblably furnishd like the king himself.

lines.speaker: earl of douglas
lines.text: A fool go with thy soul, whither it goes! A borrowd title hast thou bought too dear: Why didst thou tell me that thou wert a king

lines.speaker: hotspur
lines.text: The king hath many marching in his coats.

lines.speaker: earl of douglas
lines.text: Now, by my sword, I will kill all his coats Ill murder all his wardrobe, piece by piece, Until I meet the king.

lines.speaker: hotspur
lines.text: Up, and away! Our soldiers stand full fairly for the day.
Exeunt
Alarum. Enter FALSTAFF, solus

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Though I could scape shotfree at London, I fear the shot here heres no scoring but upon the pate. Soft! who are you Sir Walter Blunt: theres honour for you! heres no vanity! I am as hot as moulten lead, and as heavy too: God keep lead out of me! I need no more weight than mine own bowels. I have led my ragamuffins where they are peppered: theres not three of my hundred and fifty left alive and they are for the towns end, to beg during life. But who comes here
Enter PRINCE HENRY

lines.speaker: prince henry
lines.text: What, standst thou idle here lend me thy sword: Many a nobleman lies stark and stiff Under the hoofs of vaunting enemies, Whose deaths are yet unrevenged: I prithee, lend me thy sword.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: O Hal, I prithee, give me leave to breathe awhile. Turk Gregory never did such deeds in arms as I have done this day. I have paid Percy, I have made him sure.

lines.speaker: prince henry
lines.text: He is, indeed and living to kill thee. I prithee, lend me thy sword.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Nay, before God, Hal, if Percy be alive, thou getst not my sword but take my pistol, if thou wilt.

lines.speaker: prince henry
lines.text: Give it to me: what, is it in the case

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Ay, Hal tis hot, tis hot theres that will sack a city.
PRINCE HENRY draws it out, and finds it to be a bottle of sack

lines.speaker: prince henry
lines.text: What, is it a time to jest and dally now
He throws the bottle at him. Exit

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Well, if Percy be alive, Ill pierce him. If he do come in my way, so: if he do not, if I come in his willingly, let him make a carbonado of me. I like not such grinning honour as Sir Walter hath: give me life: which if I can save, so if not, honour comes unlooked for, and theres an end.
Exit FALSTAFF
